required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Network Intervention for Reducing Sexual Risk for HIV With African American Men Who Have Sex With Men (AA MSM)
clinical_study.official_title: A Network Intervention for Reducing Sexual Risk for HIV With African American Men Who Have Sex With Men (AA MSM)

lead_sponsor.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

clinical_study.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to examine the efficacy of a network-oriented "outreach intervention" to reduce HIV and sexually transmitted infection (STI) related risk behaviors among African American men who have sex with men (AA MSM)and their social network. The hypothesis is to determine whether the new intervention is more efficacious at reducing high risk sexual behaviors than the standard normal of care provided to the public (a single session of individual HIV counseling and testing.

detailed_description.textblock: The intervention increases participants' personal level of knowledge and skills concerning HIV prevention and inspires participants to diffuse the information to their social network.

primary_outcome.measure: To increase participants knowledge of HIV/STI risks to assist with decreasing high risk sex/drug behaviors

secondary_outcome.measure: To increase participants' level of knowledge and skills concerning HIV/STI prevention and diffusing the information to their social network)

arm_group.description: HIV/STI counseling and testing and a 7 session intervention to increase participants' level of knowledge and skills concerning HIV prevention (to decrease HIV acquisition or transmission) and to diffuse the information to their social network
HIV/STI counseling and testing and a single 15 minute session of resources available in the community

intervention.description: HIV/STI counseling and testing and a 7 session intervention to increase participants' level of knowledge and skills concerning HIV prevention (to decrease HIV acquisition or transmission) and to diffuse the information to their social network

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Identify as a black / African American male
- Report sex with at least 2 people in past 3 months/ 1 being male
- Willingness to take HIV test or provide documentation if HIV+
- Willingness to identify and recruit friend/relative to study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under age 18
- Identify as female or transgender
- Not identify as Black / African American

overall_official.affiliation: Johns Hopkins University -Bloomberg School of Public Health

results_reference.citation: Tobin KE, German D, Spikes P, Patterson J, Latkin C. A comparison of the social and sexual networks of crack-using and non-crack using African American men who have sex with men. J Urban Health. 2011 Dec;88(6):1052-62. doi: 10.1007/s11524-011-9611-4.

Latkin C, Yang C, Tobin K, Penniman T, Patterson J, Spikes P. Differences in the social networks of African American men who have sex with men only and those who have sex with men and women. Am J Public Health. 2011 Oct;101(10):e18-23. doi: 10.2105/AJPH.2011.300281. Epub 2011 Aug 18.

Latkin C, Yang C, Tobin K, Roebuck G, Spikes P, Patterson J. Social network predictors of disclosure of MSM behavior and HIV-positive serostatus among African American MSM in Baltimore, Maryland. AIDS Behav. 2012 Apr;16(3):535-42. doi: 10.1007/s10461-011-0014-z.

clinical_study.keyword: Men who have sex with men
